title: 108_s851
content: The "Child Custody Protection Act" may be cited as the short title. Title 18, United States Code, is amended to include a new chapter on the transportation of minors in circumvention of certain laws relating to abortion. The "Child Custody Protection Act" introduces a new chapter in Title 18, United States Code, addressing the transportation of minors across state lines for abortions, in violation of parental involvement laws. Offenders face fines or imprisonment for up to one year. The "Child Custody Protection Act" prohibits transporting minors across state lines for abortions without parental consent, with penalties of fines or imprisonment up to one year. Exceptions include abortions necessary to save the minor's life due to a physical disorder. The "Child Custody Protection Act" prohibits transporting minors across state lines for abortions without parental consent, with penalties of fines or imprisonment up to one year. Exceptions include abortions necessary to save the minor's life due to a physical disorder, injury, illness, or pregnancy-related condition. Minors and parents involved in violations are protected from prosecution or lawsuits. An affirmative defense is available for those who reasonably believed they were not violating the law. The "Child Custody Protection Act" allows for civil action by parents harmed by violations of transporting minors across state lines for abortions without required parental consent or notification. An affirmative defense is available if the defendant reasonably believed the necessary parental involvement had taken place before the abortion. A law requiring parental involvement in a minor's abortion decision includes notification or consent from a parent before the procedure, without alternative options. The term "parent" is defined within this context. The term 'parent' in a law requiring parental involvement in a minor's abortion decision includes a parent, legal custodian, or person standing in loco parentis. The term 'minor' refers to an individual not older than the maximum age for parental notification or consent. The term 'State' includes the District of Columbia and any commonwealth, possession, or other territory of the United States. A clerical amendment is made to the table of chapters for part I of title 18, United States Code. Transportation of minors in circumvention of laws relating to abortion.
